meanings.definition: Feeling no shame; lacking modesty or decency.
meanings.sent1: The shameless child proudly showed off his messy room to guests.
meanings.sent2: She was shameless in her disregard for the rules.
meanings.sent3: The shameless puppy wagged its tail after chewing up the shoes.
meanings.sent4: His shameless behavior at the party was like a neon sign demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The shameless act of cutting in line left everyone staring in disbelief.

meanings.definition: Without shame or embarrassment; bold or audacious.
meanings.sent1: The shameless student confidently argued with the teacher.
meanings.sent2: He made a shameless attempt to flirt with the waitress.
meanings.sent3: The shameless squirrel stole nuts right in front of the park ranger.
meanings.sent4: Her shameless disregard for consequences was both impressive and concerning.
meanings.sent5: The shameless act of skydiving without a parachute amazed onlookers.

meanings.definition: Done without regard for shame or embarrassment; brazen or impudent.
meanings.sent1: The shameless driver cut off other cars without signaling.
meanings.sent2: The politician's shameless lies were exposed during the debate.
meanings.sent3: In a shameless move, he ate the last piece of cake meant for everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her shameless pursuit of fame led to questionable decisions.
meanings.sent5: The shameless act of stealing candy from a baby was caught on camera.
